Description: Limestone ostracon with remains of sixteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink on one side and a further eleven lines on the other side containing Psalm 32.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.44-45, pl.36)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (111816) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/111816)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 36:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
